text: traffic problems are not unique to the
highway systems of cities like Los
Angeles in New York fungi have them too
that fungi can have many nuclei in one
cell and as that cell grows sending out
filaments it needs to keep the nuclei
mixed up and moving freely that keeps it
more vigorous stronger scientists
investigating one such fungus could
clearly see under the microscope a
highly efficient traffic system to test
whether the traffic system was the
result of accidental growth scientists
silence the gene that they thought
played a role in keeping those filaments
humming sure enough the nuclei started
to clump up the rules for growth that
make filament traffic run smoothly are
embedded in the fungal DNA the same
cannot be said for humans who designed
the Long Island Expressway
